content: How can I view mathlib contributors? Since PRs are closed instead of merged, the GitHub UI does not give the complete list.
Does https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/graphs/contributors answer your question? If not, can you be more specific: what exactly would you like to know?
(Beware, the default statistics are a bit skewed, because lots of commits (until mid-July 2023) were porting mathlib from Lean 3 to Lean 4. On that page, you can filter for certain date ranges.)

Michael Rothgang said:

Does https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/graphs/contributors answer your question? If not, can you be more specific: what exactly would you like to know?

It does not answer my question. These stats don't count people whose contribution was merged by Bors, afaik. For example, my PR was merged a month ago, and I do not appear in this list, as far as I can tell (vilin97 is my GitHub username).
The contributors page only shows the top 100 contributors I'm afraid

$ git log | grep -B1 -A3 "Vasily Ilin"
commit c4c2823fcb8b0eb245aeab75224a9554be0473ec
Author: Vasily Ilin <vasilin97@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 10 02:18:05 2024 +0000

    feat(Probability/Moments): add `mgf_smul_left` (#19798)
Out of curiosity, why are you interested in a full list?

I wanted to see if my co-author Siyuan GeÂ jamesgsy@uw.edu is in this list. He is an undergrad who did most of the work on the lemmas that I am PRs now, and I wanted to make sure that he gets the credit he deserves
Well, the only think you can ask for sure is "is the co-authorship in the commit message". Anything else is at the whim of github.
